body.name: TecTecTec ULT-G Stylish, Lightweight and Multi-Functional Golf GPS Watch, Durable Wrist Band with LCD Display, Worldwide Preloaded Courses - Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 14 hrs 42 mins
features: 𝐒𝐌𝐀𝐑𝐓 𝐆𝐎𝐋𝐅 𝐖𝐀𝐓𝐂𝐇: The ULT-G Golf GPS watch includes sophisticated features that will make your works easier. A lot of useful features to take your game to the next level. It features Bluetooth connectivity to connect the watch to your smartphone for free course updates. There are no unusual features that can drain your mobile's battery too fast.

𝐄𝐀𝐒𝐘 𝐓𝐎 𝐎𝐏𝐄𝐑𝐀𝐓𝐄: Learning to use the ULT-G watch is very simple. There are only four buttons to navigate the screen. Once the initial set-up is complete, with the touch of a button, the device will automatically connect to the satellite and begin displaying course information.

𝐄𝐕𝐄𝐑𝐘𝐓𝐇𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐘𝐎𝐔 𝐍𝐄𝐄𝐃: Measures distances to the front, back, and middle of the green. Figure out the distance of your shots. Automatic hole progression while you play golf. Access information about over 38,000 courses around the world. There is a clock to tell the time.

𝐑𝐄𝐋𝐈𝐀𝐁𝐋𝐄: Comes in a durable design. Water and dust resistance will assist you in hostile weather. Battery power to take you through 2.5 rounds before needing to be recharged. One-year warranty (online registration required), lifetime software support, and high-class customer service.

𝐌𝐎𝐍𝐄𝐘 𝐁𝐀𝐂𝐊 𝐆𝐔𝐀𝐑𝐀𝐍𝐓𝐄𝐄: We are providing you a money-back guarantee. Purchase it, and there is no risk for 30 days. If you don't love it, you will get your money back. The cost of the ULT-G watch is the only price you'll have to pay—no subscription fees for continued service or updates.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Simple, Robust, Great Value ULT-G: TecTecTec's Premier Golf Watch with Unrivaled Ease TecTecTec's ULT-G is a leading golf watch, evolving from renowned rangefinders. Boasting quick +/-1-yard precision, it weighs 6.4 oz, resists rain, and has a durable band. With a clear manual and USB charger, it suits all golfers.

Are the golf courses preloaded on the ULT-G GPS watch, and how can I ensure my specific course is available? Yes, the ULT-G GPS watch comes with over 42,000 golf courses preloaded worldwide. If by chance your specific course isn't listed, please notify us. We're committed to updating our database and will add any missing courses within a span of 5 days. Is my ULT-G GPS watch ready to use straight out of the box? Absolutely! All courses are preloaded. Just charge your watch, and it's ready. Pair with your phone only if course updates are needed. Can I use the ULT-G GPS watch to determine how far my ball traveled on a shot? Absolutely! With the "Track Shot Distance" feature on our ULT-G watch, you can determine your ball's distance by measuring between two points. Simply press the satellite button to activate this feature. How long does the battery last on the ULT-G GPS watch? The battery on the ULT-G GPS watch lasts for about 2.5 rounds of golf. Do I need to pay a subscription to update the golf courses on the ULT-G GPS watch? No, updating the golf courses is completely free and will remain so. Just ensure you have the serial number handy, which can be found on the cover of the manual.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Golf Watch!
reviews.reviewText: I've used Garmin most of the time golfing. Lost it and tried this watch. It works great! Simple instructions, finds courses fast. I'm impressed. Oh yeah, it was cheaper.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy setup. Not a fan of pin type rechargers, but this one has alignment pins and clamp that make recharging fast and easy. battery easily lasts for 2 rounds of golf and a weeks worth of watch. Operation is very easy and menu is easy to navigate. Best range finder I had had so far. a great product for the price. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very reasonable cost with superb accuracy
reviews.reviewText: Nice range finder with easy to read screen. So far I have found it very accurate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value, great performance.
reviews.reviewText: I highly recommend this product. It is well made, comfortable, and best of all, performs essentially perfectly. I happened to play yesterday at a course that had a lot of yardage markers on sprinkler heads, and I took several opportunities to stand on those spots, and the reading was exact on my device. Also, I find that the GPS system is much easier than having to carry around and then pull out your scope and stand up like a pirate trying to get a buzz on the flag. With this, you just walk up to your ball and look at your wrist as if telling the time. (Note: I guess on some holes an optical rangefinder theoretically could measure a few feet closer than the GPS, because the latter measures "front, middle, back." If you are a good enough golfer to need your measurement within inches, maybe consider that, at up to 5x the price. I'm not that person, ha.) Side notes would be that the set-up with the app is easy, and downloads of course updates are speedy. On-course use is easy and intuitive, and switching back from hazard distances to green distance is easy. This product is outstanding, and the reasonable price is a bonus. Finally, on the box, the vendor says they are committed to your satisfaction, and give you a phone number and email for any questions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s accurate and very convenient..
reviews.reviewText: Had trouble getting sat to load courses to pick from. Once loaded I loved it over a phone app.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Husband loves it. Says it works well and is easy to use. Likes better than a much more expensive golf watch we previously purchased ( and returned).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Accurate golf yardage watch; frustrating to charge!; ended up returning it.
reviews.reviewText: This is a well made, accurate yardage watch at an affordable price. I have used it twice on two different courses in Florida, and compared it to another gps yardage device, and the readings were always within 1 - 2 yards of each in distance to the front, middle, and back of a green. It also reads distance to hazards, especially useful when attempting a shot over water. BUT one huge negative: EXTREMELY difficult to correctly hook up the charging cable to the watch contacts! Came back from course yesterday and fiddled with it for 15 minutes before finally giving up for the night. Other device I have connects instantly and shows it's charging properly. This Tec Tec Tec certainly could have used a better charging system. Also, it does not hold a charge very long, even when only using it as a watch. After an initial full charge, I noticed battery was almost fully discharged in 48 hours, when it wasn't used for golf. So on your wrist, for golf, it's an inexpensive, relatively well made, yardage device. Charging it is a pain.UPDATE: 2/25/21 After getting a full charge into the watch on 02/24, battery was totally drained this morning! It was not used for golf. It was last used for golf yardage on 02/23, then fully charged yesterday. I think the battery is defective, and I returned it today, rather than request a replacement. Too bad because it was accurate and easy to operate and fit my wrist. But I had to return it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars SAVE YOURSELF TIME AND AGGRAVATION
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this product 4 or 5 months ago. The first few times I used it, it was great. Yardage was accurate. It is easy to read. Instructions on use OK. Then....all of a sudden the yardage readings were totally off. A 137 yard hole read 669! I wrote to the company, not once, not twice, but at least 3 times. Each time it was suggested that I reboot or manually input a course etc. Each time I struggled to do what I was supposed to do, not even sure I was doing the right thing. Then it would work again--once. Next time out on the course the yardage would be totally inaccurate. It was very aggravating. All of a sudden "the light bulb went off in my head" and I noticed that the real issue appeared to be that there were times when the hole number was incorrect. No wonder when I went to the back nine it made no sense! Anyway, I now check each hole number and advance it or go back and reenter the hole number until I get to the correct one. I am not saying that this is a good thing. My friend has a Golf Buddy that always calculates the hole she is on. All I am saying is that if you purchased this watch and are getting strange readings on a hole, check the hole number displayed and adjust as required. Doing this little thing can save you a whole lot of time. Rebooting and manual entry of courses is time consuming. I wish checking the hole number was a suggestion from tech support. I would have liked this product a lot more if I realized that there was a simple solution to a big problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do you want to know "yardages" on the golf course?
reviews.reviewText: It is early times, but so far the watch has met my expectations. I was seeking yardages and that's what I got. The distances have proven correct based on the results shown by "other products" owned by my fellow golfers. The watch presentation is easily read. The short-form labels of "hazards' will take some "getting-used-to"; that's to be expected. One fellow golfer was impressed by the fact that the course updating feature was cost-free - indicating that other GPS-based products allowed limited updating without incurring additional charges. So overall, it appears that the watch is a good purchase for my needs.
Dopo 2mesi l'articolo funzione bene; unica piccola pecca la batteria- dopo 18 buche bisogna ricaricarlo.

reviews.reviewTitle: The description how to use the watch isn't up to standard.
reviews.reviewText: The watch has a lot to give once you know how to use it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have waited until I have used this for about 10 rounds to get a good look at the watch and how it performs.This was my first GPS golf watch and wanted an easy to use good value for money product. I can say that it fulfills both criteria very well.It has genuinely helped my game to get a feel for how far I hit each club and get to know each hole better on my home course.The instructions provided to set up the app that supports the watch were helpful and I followed the user guide to get set up for the first round.I suspect the battery would last a couple of 18 holes rounds but I tend to fully charge before each round to be on the safe side.For anybody looking for a starter product, easy to use that will do what you need it without all the bells and whistles this watch is worth looking at.
